blog.name: pardonmymannerssir
blog.title: Pardon My Manners
blog.description: Fic writer by day, procrastinator by night.

summary:
Toying with a modern Jonsa AU; here’s a snippet.  Jon wakes to sharp, rhythmic pounding and scrambles for his
gun. It takes...
body:
Toying with a modern Jonsa AU; here’s a snippet.

Jon wakes to sharp, rhythmic pounding and scrambles for his gun.

It takes falling to the floor of his studio apartment before he remembers where and when he is. Chicago. Not Iraq. He doesn’t have a gun. He hopes to never touch one again.

He can taste blood and sand in his mouth and it almost makes him gag as he swipes a hand over his face and rises into a squat. The room is cast in shadow, a cool breeze ruffling the faded curtains that’d been there when he’d moved in almost a year ago and which he hadn’t bothered to replace. Moonlight fluttered along the sharp lines of his bed and across the rounded curves of his couch, glowing faintly against the screen of the second-hand TV he almost never turned on.

Ghost whimpers then growls softly as the knocking begins again. The sound wavers between uncertain and desperate, as if whoever stands outside his door isn’t certain how they ended up there. Disoriented and angry -it’s three AM for Christ’s sake- he stumbles across the room, unlocks the door and yanks it open. He freezes, angry words dying on his tongue.

“I d-didn’t have anywhere else to go,” Sansa Stark says through a swollen, bloody lip, a pair of sunglasses perched on her nose that don’t completely hide a black eye.

summary: As illustrated in my clearly well done coloring of this sigil (the grey doesn't work very well but the direwolf is GREY ok) I...
body:
As illustrated in my clearly well done coloring of this sigil (the grey doesn’t work very well but the direwolf is GREY ok) I would like to point out that this is clearly a combining of both the sigils for legitimate Starks and Targaryens. It is the sigil for JON SNOW aka AGEON TARGARYEN alone as he is the LEGITIMATE son of Lyanna STARK and Rhaegar TARGARYEN.

If you think it’s for a ship-I will say Jonsa is the more likely as jonsa has the better parallels with elizabeth of york/Henry Tudor which this does appear to be a call back too.

But-even more likely in my opinion-it’s a sigil made for the crew who were referred to as team ‘dragons’ and 'wolves’ during filming and it means literally nothing.


What’s increadibly unlikely in my opinion is that it has anything to do with jonerys or baby dracarys.


Thanks for coming to my TED talk see y'all again soon

summary:
So when Jon and Daenerys have their kid what will its last name be? 
Snow? though they’ll be born out of wedlock it’ll be highly...
body:
So when Jon and Daenerys have their kid what will its last name be?

Snow? though they’ll be born out of wedlock it’ll be highly unlikely their last name will be Snow

Stark? would be nice. Because if it’s a boy then the Stark can live on (Bran will probably never be able to… get it up. Whomever Sansa [have my theory that Sansa and Tyrion will end up together again] and Arya have children with - if they have children - they’ll take the father’s name ((as it was back then))) so it’d be nice to see the Stark name live on

Targaryen? same boat the Stark name is in. Dany is the only Targaryen left alive. The name Targaryen would ensure the ancient name stays alive

Or a new House to be born; Stargaryen? this would be pretty cool. As the two houses die a new house is born from the ashes. A fiery wolf. Would be ‘ight..

I’ve had this discussion with multiple people and everyone says different so I thought I’d make a post about it aha. What do y’all think?

blog.name: nothinghappensinalstonville
blog.title: Nothing Happens Here
blog.description: And that is just the way I like it - and also why I obsess over GOT. Also cats.

title: Put on Marvin Gaye and ...
body:
Let’s get it on.

When I first watched the episode ‘Stormborn’ I was puzzled by the inclusion of the GreyDei love making scene. The seventh season was speeding by, with the timeline drastically sped up and only essential scenes being shown. It was left to the viewer to imagine what actions or conversations were taking place between scenes. 

I can’t remember anyone ever saying they were hanging out for a Grey Worm / Missandei make out session but this is exactly what we were given. And it was sweet and intimate and romantic. And steamy.

But a eunuch sex scene was still a weird and unasked for inclusion in a busy season. Why? It added nothing to the plot. I thought at the time, “Oh dear, Grey Worm is not coming back.” I wasn’t the only one. Most reviewers thought it was included to give emotional heft to his death. But no. He was still alive and kicking at the end of the season.

It wasn’t some time after the season finale that it finally hit me. This scene was signalling that D&D still knew how to do romance. This is deep meta shit.

All in all the scene comes in at a leisurely 4:48 minutes. I’m going to break it down.

  • In a dark room lit by braziers Missandei comes to bid farewell to Grey Worm who was sharpening his sword. They stand face to face and talk. Grey Worm opens up emotionally about what Missandei means to him. Time 2:11 minutes.
  • Grey Worm moves in and they kiss. Time 9 seconds.
  • They slowly undress and look at each other naked: Time 1:35 minutes
  • They kiss and get onto the bed. 15 seconds
  • GW  gets on top, they gaze lovingly into each others’ eyes. (Neither has a panic attack.)  10 seconds
  • Things happen.  28 seconds

After six seasons we finally got to see Dany and Jon interact and get it on and it was … underwhelming. Watching the final love making scene, apart from Kit Harington’s perfectly sculptured behind, I can’t remember being so disappointed by a cinematic bonk since The French Lieutenant’s Woman.

The interaction between Jon and Dany was strangely underplayed, especially as everyone was expecting a grand romance, or at least sparks. Instead by the fifth episode the most we had was Dany giving Jon heart eyes as he left Dragonstone. And Jon’s farewell? “I wish you good fortune in the wars to come.” Oh Jon, you smooth talking not-a-bastard. He doesn’t even look back while he is leaving. 

We wouldn’t even know there was supposed to be a romance if it wasn’t for Davos and Tyrion mentioning Jon gazing at her boobs and being in love with her. Huh? When was this? One of the big rules of film making is show don’t tell. All you need is one good scene to show attraction. Did we get one while I was on the loo? Because I don’t remember it. Dany was definitely checking Jon out. But Jon? Not so much. 

In fact it isn’t until Jon is being taken back to Dragonstone after almost dying that he finally makes a move. She is there crying for her dragon while gazing at him all naked and Jon-like. He gazes into her eyes, grabs her hand and tries to call her a pet name (which she is having none of). (Maybe he will have to recite all her titles to her while making love. It would probably work. Oops I dropped a snark.) I love watching reaction videos. I’ve seen several of people watching this scene and in every case, when he says ‘My Queen’ the reaction is 'What??’ Because, seriously, where did that come from?

And so onto the love making scene after the under cooked romance. And suddenly without so much as a ‘hello’ or a ‘help me out of this armour’ they are full on doing it while Jon’s brother/cousin(!) provides a voiceover about how they are related and how Jon outranks her. Jon looks like he is having a panic attack in flagrante delicto. So much cognitive dissonance I’m surprised heads didn’t explode. 

The whole scene from door knocking to ship sailing lasts two minutes, and this includes door knocking, Tyrion lurking, babies being named and ships sailing. The action itself lasts a grand total of 38 seconds.

Many reviews were all along the lines of 'WTF did we just watch?’  Some questioned whether the show runners were losing their touch. How can you stuff up something this basic?

Which brings me back to the GreyDei scene. It was the show runners’ way of signalling that they still know their shit, and what they did they did on purpose.

I’ll leave you to work out the implications.

So. Was it good for you?

Dany was definitely checking Jon out. But Jon? Not so much. 

In fact it isn’t until Jon is being taken back to Dragonstone after almost dying that he finally makes a move. She is there crying for her dragon while gazing at him all naked and Jon-like. He gazes into her eyes, grabs her hand and tries to call her a pet name (which she is having none of). (Maybe he will have to recite all her titles to her while making love. It would probably work. Oops I dropped a snark.) I love watching reaction videos. I’ve seen several of people watching this scene and in every case, when he says ‘My Queen’ the reaction is 'What??’ Because, seriously, where did that come from?

And so onto the love making scene after the under cooked romance. And suddenly without so much as a ‘hello’ or a ‘help me out of this armour’ they are full on doing it while Jon’s brother/cousin(!) provides a voiceover about how they are related and how Jon outranks her. Jon looks like he is having a panic attack in flagrante delicto. So much cognitive dissonance I’m surprised heads didn’t explode. 

The whole scene from door knocking to ship sailing lasts two minutes, and this includes door knocking, Tyrion lurking, babies being named and ships sailing. The action itself lasts a grand total of 38 seconds.

Many reviews were all along the lines of 'WTF did we just watch?’  Some questioned whether the show runners were losing their touch. How can you stuff up something this basic?

Which brings me back to the GreyDei scene. It was the show runners’ way of signalling that they still know their shit, and what they did they did on purpose.

I’ll leave you to work out the implications.

So. Was it good for you?
trail.content:
Let’s get it on.

When I first watched the episode ‘Stormborn’ I was puzzled by the inclusion of the GreyDei love making scene. The seventh season was speeding by, with the timeline drastically sped up and only essential scenes being shown. It was left to the viewer to imagine what actions or conversations were taking place between scenes. 

I can’t remember anyone ever saying they were hanging out for a Grey Worm / Missandei make out session but this is exactly what we were given. And it was sweet and intimate and romantic. And steamy.

But a eunuch sex scene was still a weird and unasked for inclusion in a busy season. Why? It added nothing to the plot. I thought at the time, “Oh dear, Grey Worm is not coming back.” I wasn’t the only one. Most reviewers thought it was included to give emotional heft to his death. But no. He was still alive and kicking at the end of the season.

It wasn’t some time after the season finale that it finally hit me. This scene was signalling that D&D still knew how to do romance. This is deep meta shit.

All in all the scene comes in at a leisurely 4:48 minutes. I’m going to break it down.

  • In a dark room lit by braziers Missandei comes to bid farewell to Grey Worm who was sharpening his sword. They stand face to face and talk. Grey Worm opens up emotionally about what Missandei means to him. Time 2:11 minutes.
  • Grey Worm moves in and they kiss. Time 9 seconds.
  • They slowly undress and look at each other naked: Time 1:35 minutes
  • They kiss and get onto the bed. 15 seconds
  • GW  gets on top, they gaze lovingly into each others’ eyes. (Neither has a panic attack.)  10 seconds
  • Things happen.  28 seconds

After six seasons we finally got to see Dany and Jon interact and get it on and it was … underwhelming. Watching the final love making scene, apart from Kit Harington’s perfectly sculptured behind, I can’t remember being so disappointed by a cinematic bonk since The French Lieutenant’s Woman.

The interaction between Jon and Dany was strangely underplayed, especially as everyone was expecting a grand romance, or at least sparks. Instead by the fifth episode the most we had was Dany giving Jon heart eyes as he left Dragonstone. And Jon’s farewell? “I wish you good fortune in the wars to come.” Oh Jon, you smooth talking not-a-bastard. He doesn’t even look back while he is leaving. 

We wouldn’t even know there was supposed to be a romance if it wasn’t for Davos and Tyrion mentioning Jon gazing at her boobs and being in love with her. Huh? When was this? One of the big rules of film making is show don’t tell. All you need is one good scene to show attraction. Did we get one while I was on the loo? Because I don’t remember it. Dany was definitely checking Jon out. But Jon? Not so much. 

In fact it isn’t until Jon is being taken back to Dragonstone after almost dying that he finally makes a move. She is there crying for her dragon while gazing at him all naked and Jon-like. He gazes into her eyes, grabs her hand and tries to call her a pet name (which she is having none of). (Maybe he will have to recite all her titles to her while making love. It would probably work. Oops I dropped a snark.) I love watching reaction videos. I’ve seen several of people watching this scene and in every case, when he says ‘My Queen’ the reaction is 'What??’ Because, seriously, where did that come from?

And so onto the love making scene after the under cooked romance. And suddenly without so much as a ‘hello’ or a ‘help me out of this armour’ they are full on doing it while Jon’s brother/cousin(!) provides a voiceover about how they are related and how Jon outranks her. Jon looks like he is having a panic attack in flagrante delicto. So much cognitive dissonance I’m surprised heads didn’t explode. 

The whole scene from door knocking to ship sailing lasts two minutes, and this includes door knocking, Tyrion lurking, babies being named and ships sailing. The action itself lasts a grand total of 38 seconds.

Many reviews were all along the lines of 'WTF did we just watch?’  Some questioned whether the show runners were losing their touch. How can you stuff up something this basic?

Which brings me back to the GreyDei scene. It was the show runners’ way of signalling that they still know their shit, and what they did they did on purpose.

I’ll leave you to work out the implications.

So. Was it good for you?

blog.name: oadara
blog.title: The Path to Oadara
blog.description: To go forward, I must go back and make some delicious lemon cakes.

summary: Do you think all these prophecies will turn out to be false?
question: Do you think all these prophecies will turn out to be false?
answer:
Hello anon,

No, I don’t. For one, at least one of the prophecies we’ve heard has been constantly true, and that’s the prophecy Maggy the Frog gave Cersei .That prophecy has been in the vain of the self-fulfilling prophecy but nonetheless it has come to pass almost exactly as it was told.

As for the other prophecies, I think they’ll come to pass but not on the way most people expect it to be fulfilled. Like Mel thinking Stannis was TPTWP and it’ll probably turn out to be a combination of Jon and Dany or one or the other. The in-universe interpretation can be faulty and we have to be careful not to fall into the same trap as the characters. We see this with TPTWP, we hear about it from Mel’s prospective but later on we see how she most likely was wrong when Master Aemon provides us a different interpretation that matches more the events we’ve already witnessed.

Hope that makes sense.

TTFN
